channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Park Chan-wook and the Funny Thing About Stomach-Churning Horror
item.description: When American studios wouldn’t back his film about a laid-off manager committing gruesome murders, the director returned to Korea. Now he has a hit on...

item.title: New Yorkers Wake Up to Snow, Though Not as Much as Forecast
item.description: Predictions were revised down on Friday. Central Park still saw more than 2 inches of snow, with higher totals outside of New York City.

item.title: How One Father Created an Organ Empire

item.title: Russia Pummels Kyiv Before Trump-Zelensky Meeting
item.description: The assault began around 1:30 a.m. local time on Saturday and continued for nearly 10 hours.

item.title: A Dancing Dictator and Bankers in Chains: The Other Venezuela Blockade
item.description: A crisis more than a century ago involved U.S. aims to assert military supremacy, a hard-partying dictator and frictions among the great powers.

item.title: Dominion Energy Virginia sues over Trump order to halt offshore wind project, calling it ‘arbitrary and capricious’

item.title: Silver prices continue soaring as debt fears and geopolitical tensions send precious metals to fresh record highs
item.description: So far this year, silver has spiked 169%, platinum has shot up 172%, and palladium has soared 124%.
